alert.note: Alert for Northeastern Brooks Range (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 6:14AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...Snow In The Brooks Range Through Tonight... Up to 3 inches of snow is expected in the Central and Eastern Brooks Range through tonight. Snow will melt soon after falling in most areas below 2000 feet, but snow may accumulate in areas above 2000 ft. This includes the Dalton Highway near Atigun Pass, and the village of Anaktuvuk Pass. Snow is expected to taper off during the day Saturday. Motorists and hikers venturing into the Brooks Range above 2000 feet should prepare for snow today and tonight. A cold front pushing south over the Brooks Range is bringing the snow and cold temperatures, along with north winds gusting to 25 mph. Temperatures in the Central and Eastern Brooks Range will remain in the lower 30s today and fall into the 20s tonight. Motorists and hikers venturing into the Brooks Range above 2000 feet should prepare for snow today and tonight.
